text: Patrick Burns reports
This is Patrick Burns at the Penrith courthouse for Macquarie National News
Bankers Association spokesman Alan Cullen says banks should be entitled to set the credit card transaction fees themselves

After all this system applies in every overseas country except Australia and also in Australia credit unions already make charges of that kind because they're not covered by the same restrictions as the banks and people have not been complaining about those credit union charges where they have those cards
Consumers Association spokesman Jeff Surmy says the user-pay system would only be fair if banks dropped their credit card interest rates quite substantially
it may well even discourage people from over using credit cards
Jane Edwards has details
Jane Edwards Canberra for Macquarie National News
Shadow tourism spokesman David Jowd says all the chopping and changing shows Labor isn't taking the vital industry seriously

It's about the only industry that's got the capacity to dig up big numbers of jobs for our young people and is a major foreign exchange earner and you would think that if the government was really serious about tourism and the future growth of tourism they'd at least give it some stability
Bob Sharp has details
Mrs Chadwick says New South Wales teachers must have studied an additional pre-service course at university or be refused work
It is very good practical knowledge and experience for general classroom teachers
Vincent Gough who's in danger of losing his home says he's been forced to seek help from charities
I I know what we'd do
Mr Causley says the reports will now be used to address several key issues affecting the fishing industry
So whether that's affecting the catch of fish
Fishing cal clubs association president Bruce Shumakker says prawn trawlers must be made to change their methods to stop the waste of fish
They escape from the net before the net's actually pulled in
M B F spokesman David Jones says private health fund members contribute three billion dollars to Australia's health system each year almost half a billion more than that raised by the Medicare levy
Something that's   that is good for their   themselves their families and for the country
The two men have been reunited on Sydney radio two G B
Hello Bill
Max Mehoffer
Emotionally I'm overwhelmed
Mark Gibson reports the victim is in a critical condition with wounds to the back and to the head
